subtitle: Tiredness is normal in pregnancy
title: Why am I so tired?
content:
Created by BabyCenter

Yes, it is normal to be tired - you are not alone! Many mothers feel the same. Being pregnant puts a strain on your whole body. This can make you very tired. Even if you like staying up late, you might struggle staying awake past the early evening now.

In the early stages of pregnancy, you may feel constantly tired. Your body is growing a tiny baby and making the placenta, or afterbirth, which feeds your baby and keeps her alive. By 3 months pregnant, you will feel less tired.

Your hormone levels and need for energy are also changing fast. Your blood sugar and blood pressure tend to be lower too. This all adds to tiredness.

Having low iron levels can also make you feel tired. Try taking a daily iron tablet. This will stop you from getting anemic, when you do not have enough iron in your blood. If your iron levels are very low, you will feel even more tired and lacking in energy.

[Fatigue during pregnancy][1]


  [1]: http://www.babycenter.com/0_fatigue-during-pregnancy_2911.bc
